author: Greg Q.

description:
Stopped in for a quick hot beverage and snack before heading off to an appointment - this place is great!

Friendly service and a wonderful selection of whole bean coffees and pastries.  

The place is small and, it's a "Cell Phone Free Zone."  A nice touch when you feel like having an nice cup o'joe, pastry and conversation and don't want to talk over some ass hat on his Bluetooth (we like to call those guys Bluetools).
author: Christy L.

description: Great place - really friendly team, excellent coffee and relaxing space to stop and day dream.
author: Jo D.

description:
Alright- first of all, I need to admit that I used to work here. In fact, I was the first straight woman the current owners had hired. So I may be a *little* prejudiced in my opinions, but where better to get a review than from the horse's mouth? This was the BEST work environment I ever had. The owner makes sure to pitch in like the rest of the staff and there really is a sense of teamwork by everyone.

So- I love Spike's. I still go down there a lot, and it's the kind of place where I always run into people I know. Why? Because the staff makes a point of remembering its regular customers' names and often their drinks too. Sure, we might have taken an extra minute chatting to the person ahead of you, but this is a neighborhood coffee shop, not a drive-through.

And speaking of time, often that extra few seconds are spent making a quality drink. I mean, how often do you get your latte with a heart made in the foam? If you're seriously in a rush, the great thing is that it's perfectly OK to skip the line, grab a cup of one of the many self serve coffees, and drop your cash on the front bar with a nod to the barista. You'll probably hear someone say "Thank you" on your way out.

And if that wasn't enough, you're sure to get your candy fix from the jars lining the shelves.
author: Emily L.

description:
these folks are so great... today is the first day of Passover (can't eat bread!), and I accidentally ordered an everything bagel with egg and cheese. when I realized my mistake and canceled my order, the barista suggested we just put the egg and cheese in a bowl, thereby keeping it kosher for the holiday! it was tasty, and it was a very sweet and accommodating gesture.

I've probably come in here half a dozen times over the years, and the baristas are always in a good mood, and easy to laugh with.
author: Denise H.

description:
Dear 'Stro boys n girls-

WHY DO YOU GO TO STARBUCKS WHEN YOU HAVE SPIIIIKE'S???!

The person who can give me a good reason shall be awarded a million dollars.

In all seriousness- I recently discovered Spikes by way of the Lesbian Social Network, and immediately began asking myself: "Self, why haven't you been going to Spikes every day?!!" Now my own personal answer does seem cosmic, but for GOD'S SAKE Castro dwellers, get into Spikes. They make the best THE BEST espresso drinks in the area. 

Thank you Spikes, and the Lesbian Social Network. I owe you a great deal of my current happiness.
author: Laura S.

description:
No better coffee house in town.  Old world feel with Italian sodas, Arts and Crafts tile cases, and if you're a regular, you can open your own coffee account.  Nothing fancy...just a flash card with your name and deposit amount.  With each visit they re-tally and off you go.  The fantastic baristas know your name and your drink.  I've never been to a coffee house with employees that are as friendly, knowledgeable and funny.
This is my morning ritual...oh...and bring your dog cuz Spike's loves the K9.
author: John A.

description: Strong coffee and cozy environment! It's also a bit noisy, so this may not be the ideal place to study.  However it's the perfect place for handouts. :)
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Spike's is great.  Staff is kind, daddy's breads (vegan!) don't disappoint, and the coffee is yum.  I am always tempted to get a jawbreaker or something from one of their candy jars just because I haven't had a jawbreaker in around twenty years.  The best coffee joint around!!

update:  I've started using soy in my coffee and the soy they use here is rather sweet.  if you like a sweeter coffee drink, this is for you.  me, I prefer the unsweetened, all the better to taste the coffee.  mmmmm.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Spike's committed a cardinal coffee sin when it served me my cappuccino (to stay) in a waxed paper cup.  I like coffee a lot, and while I'm not the largest expert out there, I found that this vessel completely precluded any enjoyment I would have received from a well-made coffee.  This isn't starbucks-  if you're going to be a cafe, please act like a cafe...

I also thought that their pastries looked dry, prices were on the steeper side, and the inside, while nearly empty, carried every sound to its fullest.

They did have a wide selection of coffee beans though, which could be a good neighborhood resource.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Spike's has amazing coffee and a fancy new paint job. Everyone who works there is super friendly and there's even this one ridiculously good looking girl working there that I like to sit and look at for hours sometimes. There's usually not a wait unless it's really busy, but even if it's busy the wait's never THAT bad. I just started drinking coffee, so maybe I'm not an expert, but I think their coffee is one big cup of awesome!

There's always a nice friendly dog of some sort outside and the pastries have probably made me gain about 10-20 pounds in the last 4 months, but whatev. 

Their tip jar says that 100 out of 99 people love Spike's. So if you don't like Spike's you should probably check and make sure you're a real person.

Eat a ham and cheese croissant. It will change your life.
author: Caitlin C.

description: I loved the coffee and the strange oat, granola, honey, cranberry bar that I picked up for breakfast on a whim. A bit pricey. Not a lot of great seating and not very many electrical outlets (and no wi-fi). Better option for take out rather than for sitting in. I met a friend here to have a conversation and we ended up leaving as soon as we were done with our coffee because it just wasn't a great space for chatting. The ladies behind the counter were nice and very efficient.
author: Rachael B.

description: Great staff, great coffee.  I always feel like I made the right decision after I get coffee here.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Best cup of chai around.  I order a bi-chai, half sweet half spicy, and it does the trick.  They have for here cups too, which I really like, because that stuff matters

The staff rocks! Always nice and they seem to actually take an interest in everyone.

Seating inside and out, usually shadey outside, but whatever. No cell phones which is nice.

I come here every monday night before yoga and hang out with a friend and chat, it's the perfect place for it.  Go there, come here, whatever, you know what I mean.
author: Mike R.

description:
LOVE this place. Like, if there was a possible way for a man and a business establishment to form a union of marriage together, I would totally be down if Spike's was....

Everyone mentions the friendly staff, and I completely agree. I am gonna go beyond and give some props to Mike, for always being a cheerful and friendly ray of sunshine. I'm acknowledge at the door with a smile and a hello, when I realize I have no cash and have to pay with my ATM card, I get a, "No problem honey." And they always call me out when I have to sign it, "Mr. Hunter, if we can get your autograph right here, that'd be great." It's a personal and slightly flirty customer service that makes you feel special and leaving with a sense of happiness.

I'm mainly a plain coffee drinker, and do enjoy skipping the line when it's crazy. Sometimes when there's nothing going on, I'll stand in line and check out the decor on the wall.

This is a great place to just stop, and enjoy the moment of the day by yourself. Bring a newspaper or book and a few hours, and you've got yourself a wonderful and pleasant weekend early morning.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Sunday Morning and in a Great mood, decided to go out and get some coffee and had never been to Spike's Coffee, and now I know why.  Went in to get two Lattes and was helped by a young man, everything was good until it was time to pay, I handed him my credit card and he stated do you have cash by chance?.  I said that no one carries cash these days, his replay, my regulars do and it costs us 65 cents every time we process a card and it takes away from our profit.  I was lost for words and said nothing, if that is the case, he was more than welcome to charge me more, I had no problem with that.  I then left, my lattes where not hot and mine tasted horrible. I left them on a trash can and went to Starbucks, not my first choice but way better than spike's.  Thank you spike's for the embarrassment, bad service, and bad coffee, I think you are better off with your regulars than your new customers, you just lost this one. :(
author: Charles A B.

description: The coffee is pretty good. The main reason to go here is the friendly neighborhood atmosphere and the warm welcome of barristas.
author: Pant SF T.

description:
Friendly, knowledgeable staff and a nice place at the end of the busy part of Castro Street to sit down in the sun, sip your latte, and watch the lady with the two Labs and a goat walk them by, off the leash.

I'm giving them four because they charge a LOT more per pound (like $3) than anyone else. I mostly think it's worth it though.
author: Karsten P.

description: It was okay, not great, not horrible. I just got a regular coffee and hung out on the patio. Surprisingly it was relatively empty (perhaps it was before it was a Monday afternoon). And it's also a positive that this cafe is located away from the craziness of The Castro so I got to just enjoy the day and my coffee without too much noise.
author: Andy C.

description:
Good coffee, friendly and fun staff, and always a tribe of lovely doggies with their humans in tow.
It is my little neighbourhood destination for coffee and a doggie walk.
author: Linda F.

description:
Spikes rocks. Friendly service, great coffee - they always have a selection of freshly brewed coffees on hand, and above all a mellow ambience. Its one of those places where the staff make you feel like a regular, even if you aren't. 

My only vaguely non-positive comment is that there's not too much seating - both the indoor and outdoor tables fill up quick. But its worth hovering ... and geez, the coffee tastes just as good standing up!

Perfect for commuters stomping down to MUNI, or weekend wanderers in the Castro. Always some cute dogs out front.
author: Richard B.

description:
I love this place. Go there all the time. What's not to like? In your neighborhood; named after a cute dog; lots of cute dogs go there; some cute people go there (an eclectic bunch); some of the cute people who work there always have a sarcastic joke on hand; thankfully lacking in any trace of the corporate culture (this is Castro culture at its best); and the coffee is great!

So what if, occasionally you give me low fat instead of non-fat... I can live with that - just don't try giving me decaf... I know where you work!
author: Kingpin X.

description:
I never get tired of the hot dyke workers in Spikes, so super nice and friendly......and HOT!

More like a cool lessie hangout than a faggy coffee house.  Rock on Spikes ;)

P'ster
author: Pammy S.

description: For coffee, it's ok - a little acidic.  Their wet cappuccinos are spot on - like a sip of Europe.  Great crowd, neighborhoody - a real treasure old-school style. Muscle bears, dogs, coffee, Oh My! Real plus - no WiFi therefore The Herd bypasses the place.  Nice.
author: Sam C.

description: Really cute place, and the coffee is delicious.  I got an iced coffee on a warm day and it was strong and refreshing.  The hot coffee is good too, and if you're hanging out at the cafe the warm mugs are nice to use.  It's cozy inside and the outdoor seating is great on a sunny day.  I actually like that they don't have wi-fi because you can chat without feeling like you're bothering someone typing away on their laptop the next table over.  Spike's has a more friendly, open vibe because of that.
author: Hillary K.

description:
I have a really good friend who loves this place, so I've been here often to meet her. You can tell the employees do a good job cultivating a relationship with their patrons, since people always walk in with a smile, dogs seem to know there's always a treat, and neighbors always wave as they go by. My three stars are based solely on the atmosphere and the neighborhood feel.

However, I have yet to have a drinkable drink from this place. One time I ordered a Hazelnut soda. Now, this is something I actually drink and like, and it was so bitter I realized the soda was off. The next time I ordered a hot cocoa and it was tepid. Another time I ordered a latte, which was also lukewarm. 

Maybe it's just my luck and I should have asked for a re-do on each of these, but really, is it that hard to get these things right the first time?
author: Carla B.

description:
Spike's is my favorite neighborhood coffee joint. They make a mean cup of soy latte and the staff is hip and friendly. Also, there is often great artwork on the wall and the tables out front are often full of Castro residents and their dogs :) 

They also serve various treats, bagels, etc and on Friday, they've got fabulous donut treats as well!
author: Jeska D.

description:
I live right around the corner from this spot but unfortunately have only had one chance to hop in and I'm very happy I did.  We were greeted warmly when we entered and when I asked for chai I was offered a choice! oh imagine that. very delicious chai - which was nice because alot of places don't make it very well. and to my small amazement found out in conversation that the person helping us was also the owner. that doesn't always happen so it was a nice surprise. I'm also fond of the bulldog theme because I think they are happy, cute, slobbery creatures.

great everything bagels and other treats. good coffee.
author: michella s.

description:
The best thing about Spikes? The COFFEE, man! This place feels claustrophobic with anything more than 2 people in it, so I have a hard time with people reviewing ambiance in a place this small. It's essentially a coffee counter people, get over it.

That said, the make great coffee and tea here. Even the snacks are yummy. The staff is always helpful too. Plus it always makes me feel all warm and fuzzy inside knowing I can get a great cup of joe from someplace other than Starbucks.
author: Nick R.

description:
One of my fav coffee shop in the city.

People are super friendly and pleasant, good latte, and there are always bunch of dog lovers/owners hanging there.  I take my dog for a walk in the morning and stop by Spike's to get my latte - this way, my dog can get some treats there, too while I'm waiting for my coffee.

They don't hustle up to make your espresso drinks, but you will see/taste why.

And their chocolate sherry cake is good but is also hard to get.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Wow, who designed the interior of this place? The counter where you sugar and milk your coffee is right next to the self-serve coffee pots AND the order counter. The service is so achingly slow that there are always people waiting to get their drinks and there is no fricking room. Get a clue, people! I felt like I was ordering coffee inside a phone booth. The staff were adorable and charming, but when they're 6 inches from your face I guess they kind of have to be. 
Call me when you remodel. The coffee was pretty darn good.
author: J D.

description: Hands down the best "short pull, non-fat cappuccino" in the City.  What more can be said?  Well, OK, I can also say that they have incredibly friendly servers, great candy, and a great selection of coffee beans.  Now, I'm not going to knock the chain coffee stores, but come on, when you can get a "couture" custom coffee here, why go elsewhere.  Thanks Spikes . . .
author: D H.

description: Good tea and coffee selection and super yummy bagels.  Great atmosphere with a really cute patio to enjoy the sunshine.
author: Marlie H.

description: Discovered Spike's while living in the Bay area and considered it a step above the more generic national chains--great atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, tasty treats, dog-friendly, cellphone free zone, and AMAZING coffees! Since moving to the San Joaquin valley, we order from Spike's almost monthly-having become huge fans of Mysore Nuggets and the 5 Country blend.  The organic Peru is a runner up, but, nothing starts the day like the Mysore Nuggets-superb Indian coffee.  Thank you Spike's for being authentic, inventive and decently priced.  (and great online service, too!)
author: Don S.

description:
I always enjoy Spike's. They have a really good variety of tea, which they always let you smell. If you're a tea beginner, they'll even do their best to help find a tea that matches up with your taste. 
They also have a good selection of coffee and other hot drinks, such as hot chocolate and cider, or Italian sodas if you need something cool. 
The food is also good and usually gone if you get there too late. The pumpkin pie bars taste just like the pie my mom makes and the bagels are warm and comfy.
Overall, if you're in the Castro and need a break from life or just in the mood for a light lunch, head to Spike's. They'll give you the R&R and love that you need.
author: Jacqi M.

description: Ok it's a neighborhood fav!... Super friendly service, always with a smile...even if they have had the same kinda night!  I love the regulaar and soy latte...Katz bagels....the bomb!  Great pastries & candy.  Downside...not a fan of the drip coffee...Latte & Mocha all the way...
author: Patrick G.

description: You know I was gonna give them 4 stars because they have no wireless... but I've come to love them for something else.  They are a more old-fashioned coffee house.  And I bring my iPhone and can check email and such there.  Mostly I like to wake up by getting out in the morning and hanging out there.  The staff are really nice and they have oatmeal, which is my breakfast of choice.  OH don't forget donuts on Friday and Saturday!  They also sell beans.  They make great lattes.  Cappucinos... well they put all that frothy foam and I'm not so into that.  It's really cozy in here and they have outside seating too.  I love my new neighborhood coffee place.
author: Aaron W.

description: I thought the coffee was good here but honestly, the main reason for my dissatisfaction, is that i thought for sure this would be a dog friendly cafe...alas it is not. In fact, they have a little patio with a sign that says no dogs are allowed. Given that there is a dog on the sign of the cafe and there is indeed outdoor seating, I was confused and disappointed that it was not dog friendly.
author: Min M.

description:
Ummmhh,

Oh my gosh, support your local coffee shop and forget about the Starbucks monopoly!

Awesome SHERRY CAKE, gotta try it!!!!
author: H W.

description: Nearly 5 years later and I'm still getting my morning (and mid-morning, noon, afternoon and evening) caffeine fix at this neighborhood institution.  Going to Spike's is like visiting the parts of your family tree you actually like.  In our time-obsessed society, how sweet it is to know that things slow down and you can enjoy a delicious coffee and conversation the minute you step through those doors...
author: Aaron G.

description: As good as Blue Bottle is, we find ourselves at Spikes every week...they are cool and the coffee is smooth.
author: johnny h.

description: Everyone is super duper nice and friendly.. but not the fake friendly.. like hey its you again how are ya friendly..!!  i always get my boss lattes here and i never had a complaint.. i normally get iced teas n they are super yummy! i had a cinamonroll here a while back and it was very good too... this place is all smiles!!!!!!!!!
author: MiLLie M.

description: good neighborhood  coffee place great location and friendly service.
author: B H.

description: So a friend and I came for a pick-me-up before heading to a concert after a rather good-sized dinner, and about a half hour before Spike's closing time. The staff were so kind in letting us take our time to figure out the drinks we wanted. My friend appreciated his medium coffee (I think it was the house roast), and I enjoyed my white mocha. And due to the proximity of our visit to closing time, one staff member even offered us some pastries that might otherwise would have been pitched, a very kind thing indeed (no, they were not bad at all, really). All in all, a cute little place to visit with some great coffee, friendly, generous staff, and a good selection of treats.
author: Ryan T.

description: I don't drink coffee any more so I can't comment on that...but I can say the Italian sodas were to die for!  The vibe in this place is just awesome, the friendliest people around.  I had a blast for the 30 minutes I was in here on Saturday!  I am stoked to have a new, local hang....
author: Claire C.

description: Great staff, who make a mean Americano that STAYS hot. And when I'm in the mood for a hot tea, the Hippy Blend is incredible. All this across the street from my shop. How can I want for more?
author: Jeff C.

description: I love Spikes!  Not just for their Coffee & Tea and much better prices than the large YUPPIE chains, but for the people.  You can find me there almost every morning with the rest of the usuals and I cannot think of a better way to start the day.  Friendly Staff, Good Friends, Good Coffee.
author: Rebecca G.

description: There coffee is great but I always say the customer is right.  I went to pay with my Visa card and they said they take it but prefer if i would pay cash.  They said is keeps the cost down.  As it is, their drinks are the same price as anywhere in the Castro.  If I want to pay with a card that they except then I should be able to and not feel pressured to pay cash when I had little on me.  Now I have to go the the ATM for cash for MUNI.
author: Bryan M.

description: As a regular at Spikes on school days, I spend a great deal of my coffee intake at Spikes. The staff is spectacular and patient with the hordes of children that stream in before school around the corner. Mike and crew are sooo nice, always great at helping out the local school community and the coffee is excellent. They have great chai and a good selection of tea and yummy pastry type things...
author: eve b.

description: When I moved to the city, I was thrilled to find a coffee place nearby. I'm even MORE thrilled to discover that Spike's is a fantastic place to get coffee nearly any time of day! It's open nice and early in the morning for a coffee-and-bagel on the way to work (omg, their bagels are fantastic) and they have lots of little tables to sit and enjoy a drink in the afternoon. All the staff are very friendly and nice and it's very clear that this is a neighborhood favorite: the staff greets many people by name and are also ready to have a conversation. The store itself is a little small so it can easily look packed, but it always moves quickly. The muffins are yummy, the coffee is tasty, five stars across the board.
author: Katie R.

description: my bff lives two blocks away from spikes. everytime i visit this is the our first stop in the morning: two large DSLs and a croissant.  We usually try and make an afternoon stop for an iced hippie blend tea. I get a pound of hippie blend sent to me once a month because it is just so amay amay i can't live without it.
author: Wind T.

description: Spike's ROCKS! Great coffee, good pastries and a warm atmosphere. Plus it's owned by the cutest coffee shop owner in town.
author: Scott R. D.

description: I love this place. I have several reasons for this. They are as follows:the sencha, the yerba matte, the russian caravan, and baby, don't miss, DO NOT MISS- the Pai Mu Tan! I have never had this one anywhere else...does anyone else even have it?   This place has a fantastic tea selection! I'm a bigger tea drinker than I am a coffee drinker these days but I do enjoy the Kenya AA which is a light roast.
author: Lucy W.

description: Wonderful neighborhood coffee house with the best prices in town. Very friendly and fun employees who always serve with a smile. A true gem of the Castro.
author: Len M.

description: I like Spike's.  I'm not against corporate coffee, by any means, but I love the atmosphere of Spike's Coffee.  I went in and had a mild coffee that had a subtle cinammon flavor to it.  It reminded me how my mother brewed coffee.  The staff was genuinely friendly, and didn't make me feel like an idiot ,when I got slightly lost, on my way to the bathroom.
author: Carlos C.

description: Really good coffee.  Really good service, and you just want to date them all!  ;)
author: M M.

description: a great little neighborhood coffee shop.  Everyone is super friendly and make those cute foamy hearts in my lattes :)
author: Nick G.

description: Super cute baristas and nice coffee. I only wish they had wifi and more seating. But I love that they are so dog friendly.
author: Kitten M.

description: This is by far the best decaf latte in the city.  No doubt.  I am caffeine sensitive but I love the flavor of good and strong flavorful coffee.  This stuff is even delicious iced.  Wow, and really nice baristas too.  Hmmm....cute and nice.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: This may be my new favorite coffee joint, beating out Sundance Coffee and Chat's in my hood (Potrero/Dog Patch).  My soy latte was perfect.  I mean perfect - no reason to add any sweetener or other flavor to it.
author: Nate B.

description: All I get here is regular coffee and a day old pastry. It's always great. Nice place to sit and realx and take the day in. Great staff!
author: Burt F.

description:
cute, cozy atmosphere, yummy coffee and delicious treats...  

plus the staff is friendly (they yelled at me once about using my cell phone inside, but i understand).  there are always nice dogs hanging around outside, too, which is a plus.
author: Elle B.

description: Needed some breakie snacks for a work meeting, and they bagged us up fresh bagels and individual cream cheese packs in 1 minute flat.  Would have been nice if they had more bottled juice choices to grab n go, but all in all we got what we wanted super fast and super tasty.
author: Melanie C.

description: Good coffee, good service.  And they don't make fun of me when I roll in in the morning in my pajamas with bedhead.
author: Laura S.

description: One of the best looking coffee joints in town.   Great location and the friendliest staff!  I always get the feeling that they are either piecing together little bits of genius or having a really fun party until someone comes in and then they stop to grind some beans or make a latte.  This probably just means they are happy people and I have an overactive imagination.  Either way it's a great spot.  Oh and the coffee is fabulous.  They have beans with a kick and caffeine content is provided. . . try the morning rush. . . . the best legal buzz around.   You can also get creative with your flavored syrups if you're into that.  Banana latte anyone?
author: Valerie D.

description: This is the total neighborhood joint.  People go to this place every day and are welcomed by name and dogs are royalty.  They serve a mean soy latte and they make this cute little heart in the foam (awh).  You can also order their coffee by the bean to grind and brew at home.  This is the kind of place that makes me forget I live in a big city.
author: Piper B.

description: A regular coffee stop of mine, Spike's is where it's at!!!  Love the coffee, the space's feel (very chill cafe w/ outdoor area), and the friendly/personable staff.
author: kyle w.

description: They make the best pumpkin pie latte here. It also comes with a side of witty comments from their staff. What is there not to love about Spike's?
author: Kristen R.

description: The very best coffee in the Castro! The people are very cool. Lovely location and the most enjoyable soy lattes. What more do you need? Visit Spikes and tip well.
author: Dustin H.

description: Spike's Coffees & Teas is a very enjoyable establishment for me. The service I receive is impressive and courteous. I'm greeted by the staff as are other regulars and new customers. Doggies are allowed to sit out the front door with a fresh bowl of water and await the return of their master(s). Spike's has a great variety of coffee and teas for your consumption. And not to forget a sweet treat or a fantastic Croissant or bakery item, Spike's as the treat. Be sure to promote this business by purchasing a T-shirt and/or a mug with the Spike's logo. Thank you to the team of Spike's and to your leader.
author: Donald P.

description:
I'm not a huge coffee drinker, so the best thing about this place is their tea selection. I could literally try a different tea every day of the month. The staff (especially Bonnie!) are very helpful because I'm way too indecisive. I've yet to try their pastries, but it all looks good. 

I think its cool that they let local artists display and sell their work.

Service: *****
Selection: *****
Taste: *****
author: Austin B.

description: I love everything about this cafe. It's small and unpretentious (a double shock for being in the Castro.), the coffee and espresso is excellent (one of the top 5 places the city), especially if you prefer a beverage with Soy, and the service is quick and friendly. I think I'd live at this place if it only offered wireless internet access. Please?!
author: Michael A.

description: Enjoyed a chilly Sunday afternoon at Spike's. Excellent coffee, very friendly service, and a spot perfect for people watching. The only downside is no WiFi, but that's just more reason to read the Sunday paper.
author: Jason B.

description: 5 stars definitely for the friendly atmosphere. I don't drink coffee anymore, but I had a craving for a soy hot chocolate. Theirs was absolutely delish. And I recommend trying the chocolate chip cookies as well. A richer taste/alternative to Hot Cookie up the street (don't get me wrong, LOVE them as well).
author: Alona N.

description: After a night of drinking, I was looking for some coffee and found this place. The staff was great and seemed to be genuinely happy to be there. The coffee is really good and the place smell wonderful. I have to agree with some of the other posters here to forget Peets and Starbucks and go here for coffee. I am definitely making this my Saturday/Sunday morning coffee place.
author: Mark M.

description: for those in the know, this is the place to go to get your morning on. as i am a do-it-yourself kind of gal, i like that i get to select and pour my own coffee before handing it over the counter to get au-lait-ed. and when it comes back with a foam-swirled heart, i  feel truly adored. the staff is super friendly - with one guy i'ts *almost* a bit much pre-caffeine. but the chics are cool and everyone means well and takes your business seriously. i like that. and one more plus for spike's is that it is doggy friendly- there are at least 3 at all times hanging out in front by the statue of this cafe's namesake.
author: julia r.

description: Spike's has quickly become my favorite neighborhood coffee shop. The staff is super friendly and attentive, and the ambiance of the place is relaxed, personal and very local.  The coffee and pastries hit the spot. I'm a fan of the House Blend. I've not had many of the fancier coffee drinks, but they have them all, as well as some unique creations of their own. This place has tons more personality than any of the chain coffee shops in the Castro. I also like the fact that it has a neighborhood-center kind of feel. It's a place where locals come to chat and hang out with their neighbors. "These are the people in your neighborhood" as the old Sesame Street song goes,  Big thumbs up.
author: David M.
